text.author: Guardian Staff; Guardian staff reporter
text.title: Silvio Berlusconi: Did I say that?

main.p: The women of the Right are certainly the most beautiful ... the Left has no taste, not even when it comes to women (2008)
I am the Jesus Christ of politics. I am a patient victim, I sacrifice myself for everyone (2006)
Only Napoleon has done more than me. I am fighting communism just as Churchill fought the Nazis (2006)
It's the fate of the lion in winter: all his billions, all his television channels cannot rescue him from the mockery that rains down on the aged lecher, his powers visibly waning (2008)
They keep calling me a dwarf, but I'm taller than Sarkozy and Putin (2008)
People will vote for Daniela Santanch√® because she is a beautiful babe (2008)
I'll try not to let you down and I promise you two and a half months of complete sexual abstinence until election day (2006)
I know a producer in Italy is making a film on the Nazi concentration camps. I'll suggest you for the role of commandant. You'd be perfect (2003)
I have little hair because my brain is so big it pushes the hair out (2001)

Ladies, I have a mission for you on election day: cook! Sweet and exquisite things, please. Bring them to the polling station to be examined. The boldest can try making a tart, the most skilful, profiteroles (2008)
In the China of Mao, they did not eat children, but had them boiled to fertilise the fields (2006)
He never killed anyone, he sent people on holiday to confine them (2003)
We must fight against tax evasion but also defend the rights of tax evaders, or companies that make mistakes (2006)
In order to make that job you must be mentally disturbed (2003)
They're not gaffes. I've made no gaffes (2008)
